intro: Coelorachis rottboellioides, commonly known as the Rottboell's coelorachis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in wetlands or along stream banks. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, often clustered in dense, cylindrical spikes. Coelorachis rottboellioides is often found in temperate regions and is adapted to thrive in humid environments.
